subject: Education
title: Think-Pair-Share: Assessment as Conversation
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Think-Pair-Share: Assessment as Conversation.

hook.text: A teacher asks a question. Three hands go up. The other 27 students? No idea what they think.

buildup.text: Think-Pair-Share ensures every student processes the question: think alone, discuss with a partner, share.

discovery.text: It democratizes participation and gives teachers a window into the whole class's understanding.

twist.text: The 'pair' phase is where most learning happensâ€”articulating ideas reveals gaps you didn't know you had.

climax.text: Studies show Think-Pair-Share increases participation by over 400% compared to hand-raising alone.

punchline.text: The best assessment of understanding is explaining it to someone else.

quiz.question: Why is the 'pair' phase of Think-Pair-Share most valuable?
options: Articulating ideas to a partner reveals gaps in your own understanding
It allows students to copy each other's answers
It reduces the total time spent on the activity
